attributes.action: reject petitons that comment on the will of 'God', a being who may not exist, for decisions on law and policy.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
How can law and policy decisions be based on the supposition of a being that cannot be proven to even exist?

The terms and conditions of the petition system insist "potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements;" are grounds for rejection. I believe the supposition of a divine being existing is potentially false.

For example "If God had intended for..." being the opening sentence from the petition to Stop the teaching of homosexual sex in schools. A policy opposing the issue would make no sense if based on the opinions that a being who may or may not exist has.

rejection.details: Comments on the e-petitions system should be sent to team@petitions.pm.gov.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
